document.ModsDocTitle: Two new species in the subfamily Perlinae (Plecoptera, Perlidae) from China
document.docAuthor: Wang, Hong-Liang, Wang, Guo-Quan & Li, Wei-Hai
document.docTitle: Kamimuria guangxia Wang, Wang & Li, 2013, sp. n.
document.masterDocTitle: Two new species in the subfamily Perlinae (Plecoptera, Perlidae) from China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Two new species in the subfamily Perlinae (Plecoptera, Perlidae) from China

subSubSection.paragraph: Holotype: male, originally labeled as China: Guangxi autonomous region, Tian'e County, Buliuhe River, light trap, 25.0005N , 107.1738E , 16 Aug. 2002, Ding Yang. Paratypes: 2 males, same data as holotype.

Forewing length 14.8 - 15.0 mm. General body color dark brown. Head slightly wider than pronotum, generally brown with darker, quadrate interocellar region, the anterior corners of which extend laterally in teneral specimen, M-line pale (Figs 1A-B); compound eyes dark; antennae dark brown. Pronotum dark brown with rugose surface (Fig. 1A); wing membrane brown, veins darker; femora pale basally, otherwise dark (Fig. 1E).

caption.paragraph: Figure 1. Kamimuria guangxia Li & Wang, sp. n. (male). A Head and pronotum, dorsal view (teneral specimen) B Head and pronotum, dorsal view (older specimen) C Terminalia, dorsal view D Hemitergal process, lateral view E Foreleg, lateral view.
Figure 2. Kamimuria guangxia Li & Wang, sp. n. (male). A Terminalia, dorsal view B Hemitergal process, lateral view C Aedeagus before eversion, ventral view.
Figure 3. Kamimuria guangxia Li & Wang, sp. n. (male). A Aedeagus, dorsal view B Aedeagus, lateral view.

subSubSection.paragraph: The specific epithet refers to Guangxi autonomous region where the type specimen was collected.

The male of Kamimuria guangxia is characterized by the hemiterga being slightly swollen apically. The aedeagal sac is membranous, medially constricted, apex expanded, heart-shaped and mostly covered with fine to tiny spines (Figs 1C, 2B). The new species is similar to Kamimuria atra Sivec & Stark, 2008, a species known both from Vietnam and Thailand, in general body color and features of terminalia, but tergum 8 of the new species has no sensilla basiconica patch.
